alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Knox; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:08PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Knox and Roane. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour across the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next couple hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, La Follette, Farragut, Oliver Springs, Louisville, Jacksboro, Caryville, Rocky Top, Norris, Disney, Norris Dam State Park, Andersonville, Karns and Cove Lake State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
